## Functions

|  Function | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [angleDistanceDeg(a, b)](./harp-geoutils.mathutils.angledistancedeg.md) | Return the minimal delta between angles <code>a</code> and <code>b</code> given in degrees.<!-- -->Equivalent to <code>a - b</code> in coordinate space with exception vector direction can be reversed that if <code>abs(a-b) &gt; 180</code> because trip is shorter in 'other' direction.<!-- -->Useful when interpolating between <code>b</code> and <code>a</code> in angle space. |
|  [copyVector3(from, to)](./harp-geoutils.mathutils.copyvector3.md) | Copies the vector across. |
|  [interpolateAnglesDeg(p0, p1, t)](./harp-geoutils.mathutils.interpolateanglesdeg.md) | Interpolate linearly between two angles given in degrees. |
|  [newEmptyBox3()](./harp-geoutils.mathutils.newemptybox3.md) | Creates a new empty bounding box. |
|  [newVector3(x, y, z)](./harp-geoutils.mathutils.newvector3.md) | Creates a new \[Vector3Like\] instance. |
|  [newVector3(x, y, z, v)](./harp-geoutils.mathutils.newvector3_1.md) | Creates a new \[Vector3Like\] instance. |
|  [normalizeAngleDeg(a)](./harp-geoutils.mathutils.normalizeangledeg.md) | Normalize angle in degrees to range <code>[0, 360)</code>. |
|  [normalizeLongitudeDeg(a)](./harp-geoutils.mathutils.normalizelongitudedeg.md) | Normalize latitude angle in degrees to range <code>[-180, 180]</code>. |
